txt.en: Marsh-flies infest the bogs around Harwick, making noise that disturbs the war-steeds. The eccentric guard of the stables spoils his steeds, and wishes for the noise to be silenced.
'You were very good to silence the noise-makers, [placeholder]. The horses would surely thank you, if they could speak our tongue, but my thanks will have to do!'
Marsh-flies infest the bogs around Harwick, making noise that disturbs the war-steeds. The eccentric guard of the stables spoils his steeds, and wishes for the noise to be silenced.
The bog to the west of Harwick is inhabited by a swarm of Marsh-flies.\n\nYou should defeat marsh-flies for disturbing the sensitive ears of the pampered steeds in Harwick's stables.
Talk to Céolstan at the Harwick Stables

Céolstan awaits your return inside of the stable-gates in Harwick.\n\nYou should inform Céolstan that his horses may now sleep easier, for you have silenced the noise-makers that disturbed their rest.
